oai_dc:dc.dc:title: HURRICANE STORM SURGE CONSIDERED AS A RESONANCE PHENOMENON
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Abraham, G.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: hurricane
surge
gravity wave
resonance
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A model study was performed to study the water gravity waves generated by a circular local disturbance of pressure, advancing with constant velocity over the surface of water of constant depth. The results indicate that under critical conditions a resonance type phenomenon occurs for which the associated wave heights have a maximum value. It is shown that the resonant conditions may be an important factor for the generation of the surge due to hurricanes, that approach the coast perpendicularly.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 7 (1960): Proceedings of 7th Conference on Coastal Engineering, The Hague, The Netherlands, 1960.; 31
